course.title: Modern Arabic Literature Seminar: Lebanese Civil War: Histories and Fictions
course.description: Examines the roots and issues of the Lebanese Civil War (1975-90) and its continuing impact on modern Arabic fiction. The syllabus pairs realistic and romanticized representations of family, sectarianism, and gender binaries against the destruction and fantasy of the urban landscape. Themes include nostalgia and memory, exile and return. Films and documentaries will also be viewed.
course.notes: Arabic helpful but not required. Open to both undergraduates and graduates.
